description: The Arkansas English Language Arts Standards for Grades K-12 have been developed to prepare students for success after high school. Students who are successful in college or careers have attained particular literacy capacities: They demonstrate independence; they build strong content knowledge; they respond to the varying demands of audience, task, purpose, and discipline; they comprehend as well as critique; they value evidence; they use technology and digital media strategically and capably; and they come to understand other perspectives and cultures.
title: Arkansas English Language Arts Standards

description: Mathematics Content Statements
title: Mathematics Content Statements

description: English Language Arts Content Statements
title: English Language Arts Content Statements

description: The South Carolina College- and Career-Ready Standards for English Language Arts (ELA) 2015 are the result of a process designed to identify, evaluate, synthesize, and create the most high-quality, rigorous standards for South Carolina's students. The standards are designed to ensure that South Carolina students are prepared to enter and succeed in economically viable career opportunities or postsecondary education and ensuing careers.
title: South Carolina College- and Career-Ready Standards for English Language Arts

description: The Kentucky Academic Standards: Reading and Writing help ensure all students throughout Kentucky are provided with common content and have opportunities to learn at high levels. Students need vast literacy abilities and ever-changing technological competencies. They assist students in connecting learning to the world beyond the classroom by exploring and investigating real issues and problems of communities, states, the nation and the world.
title: Kentucky Academic Standards: Reading and Writing

description: West Virginia's College- and Career-Readiness Standards for English Language Arts promote proficiency in reading a range of material, fluency in writing in several modes, adaptability in verbal and written communication, and integrity in responsible collaboration with peers. Students will develop problem solving and critical thinking skills independently and collaboratively as they engage in the four domains of reading, writing, speaking/listening, and language. College- and career-readiness is supported in English language arts as students acquire and further develop their abilities to be critical consumers of what they read or hear and informed sources when they write or speak.
title: West Virginia College- and Career-Ready Standards for English Language Arts

description: The goal of the Louisiana Student Standards for English Language Arts (ELA) is to produce a literate person in the twenty-first century. The Standards establish grade-level expectations for all students meaning what students will learn. Decisions about how to teach these expectations are left up to local districts, schools, and teachers.
title: Louisiana Standards for English Language Arts

description: The 2017 English Language Arts Standards were created with a goal to meet the vision of the Kansas State Board of Education: To Lead the World in the Success of Each Student. To this end, these standards were built with the purpose of providing educators, parents, and other education stakeholders a clear view of what English Language Arts and Literacy instruction should look like in Kansas.
title: Kansas English Language Arts Standards

description: The Colorado Academic Standards: Reading, Writing and Communicating were written for all students using the content, concepts, skills and language conventions and structures found within the English language. By using these guidelines, qualified and well prepared educators can ensure that all English Learners receive appropriate support to ensure all students successfully meet the expectations in the standards.
title: Colorado Academic Standards: Reading, Writing and Communicating

description: Idaho Hand Writing Standards (K-6)
title: Idaho Hand Writing Standards (K-6)

description: K-5 and High School Science Content Statements
title: Science Content Statements

description: These K–12 standards define what students should understand and be able to do by the end of each grade. The standards were created in order to help ensure that all students are college and career ready in literacy no later than the end of high school.
title: Ohio Learning Standards English Language Arts

description: Health Content Statements
title: Health Content Statements

description: Physical Education Content Statements
title: Physical Education Content Statements

description: History Content Statements for grades K-12.
title: History Content Statements

description: This document replaces The Ontario Curriculum: Social Studies, Grades 1 to 6; History and Geography, Grades 7 and 8, 2013. Beginning in September 2018 all social studies, history, and geography programs for Grades 1 to 8 will be based on the expectations outlined in this document.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Social Studies, Grades 1-6; History and Geography, Grades 7-8

description: The National Standards for Family and Consumer Sciences Education are expectations of what students should know and be able to do upon completion of a sequence of courses in a defined pathway/program of study.
jurisdiction: National Association of State Administrators of Family and Consumer Sciences
title: National Standards for Family and Consumer Sciences Education

description: The Kentucky Academic Standards: Mathematics do not dictate curriculum or teaching methods; learning opportunities and pathways will continue to vary across schools and school systems and educators should make every effort to meet the needs of individual students, based on their pedagogical and professional impressions and information. The order in which the standards are presented is not the order in which the standards need to be taught. Standards from various domains are connected and educators will need to determine the best overall design and approach, as well as the instructional strategies needed to support their learners to attain grade-level expectations and the knowledge articulated in the standards.
title: Kentucky Academic Standards: Mathematics

description: In the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies for Grade 5, students survey the history of the United States from 1565 to the present.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies - Grade 5

description: In the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies for Grade 4, students examine the history of Texas from the early beginnings to the present within the context of influences of North America. Historical content focuses on Texas history, including the Texas Revolution, establishment of the Republic of Texas, and subsequent annexation to the United States.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies - Grade 4

description: In the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies for Grade 3, students learn how diverse individuals have changed their communities and world. Students expand their knowledge through the identification and study of people who made a difference, influenced public policy and decision making, and participated in resolving issues that are important to all people. Throughout Grade 3, students develop an understanding of the economic, cultural, and scientific contributions made by individuals.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies - Grade 3

description: In the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies for Grade 2, students focus on a study of their local community by examining the impact of significant individuals and events on the history of the community as well as on the state and nation.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies - Grade 2

description: In the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies for Grade 1, students study their relationship to the classroom, school, and community to establish the foundation for responsible citizenship in society.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies - Grade 1

description: The Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies for Kindergarten focuses on the study of the self, home, family, and classroom establishes the foundation for responsible citizenship in society.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies - Kindergarten

description: The Wisconsin Standards for English Language Arts specify what students should know and be able to do in the classroom. They serve as goals for teaching and learning. Setting high standards enables students, parents, educators, and citizens to know what students should have learned at a given point in time. In Wisconsin, all state standards serve as a model. Locally elected school boards adopt academic standards in each subject area to best serve their local communities. Clear statements about what students must know and be able to do are essential in making sure our schools offer opportunities to get the knowledge and skills necessary for success beyond the classroom.
title: Wisconsin Standards for English Language Arts

description: The AASL Standards Framework for Learners reflects a comprehensive approach to teaching and learning by demonstrating the connection between learner, librarian, and library standards.
title: AASL Standards Frameworks for Learners

description: The Maine Learning Results: English Language Arts and Literacy Standards represent a body of knowledge and skills that students need to become lifelong learners. These standards are not a checklist, but key components of reading, writing, speaking, and listening instruction, and they should be treated as such. Frequent, intentional reference to and instruction in these skills is essential to teaching students to be clear communicators in every medium and field.
title: Maine Learning Results: English Language Arts and Literacy Standards

description: The Wisconsin Standards for Mathematics focus on ensuring every student has the ability to develop deep mathematical understanding as a confident and capable learner. To develop deep mathematical understanding, positive mathematical identity, as well as strong mathematical agency, students need instruction that recognizes the broader purpose of mathematics.
title: Wisconsin Standards for Mathematics

description: The expectations that make up this curriculum also provide the opportunity for students to develop socialemotional learning skills and well-being. This practical, balanced approach will help students move successfully through elementary and secondary school and beyond. In health and physical education, students will learn the skills needed to be successful in life as active, healthy, and socially responsible citizens.
title: The Ontario Curriculum Health and Physical Education Grades 1-8

description: The Indiana Academic Standards Mass Media: Grades 9-12 are designed to help educators, parents, students, and community members understand what students need to know and be able to do at each grade level, and within each content strand, in order to exit high school college and career ready. The academic standards should form the basis for strong Tier 1 instruction at each grade level and for each content area for all students, in alignment with Indiana's vision for Multi-Tiered Systems of Supports (MTSS).
title: Indiana Academic Standards Mass Media: Grades 9-12

description: The Kansas Handwriting Curricular Standards define what students should understand and do by the end of each grade level, or developmental level. The anchor and grade-specific standards are necessary complements - the former providing broad standards, the latter providing additional specificity. Together, these define the skills and understandings that all students should demonstrate when producing handwritten text.
title: Kansas Handwriting Curricular Standards

description: The Arkansas Technical Math for College and Career Content Standards builds on previous high school math courses to extend mathematical topics and relationships. Emphasis is placed on the application of mathematics in context and on modeling - a process that uses mathematics to represent, analyze, make predictions, or otherwise provide insight into real-world situations. Students collect, organize, describe, and use quantitative data and draw inferences from real-world data.
title: Arkansas Technical Math for College and Career Content Standards

description: The Arkansas Quantitative Literacy Content Standards builds on Algebra I to explore mathematical topics and relationships. Emphasis will be placed on applying modeling as the process of choosing and using appropriate mathematics and statistics to analyze, to better understand, and to improve mathematical understanding in real world situations. Students will represent and process their reasoning and conclusions numerically, graphically, symbolically, and verbally. Quantitative Literacy will help students develop conceptual understanding by supporting them in making connections between concepts and applying previously learned material to new contexts.
title: Arkansas Quantitative Literacy Content Standards – Act 480

description: The Information Technology career cluster contains detailed curriculum frameworks. With partners from education, business and industry, and trade associations, the curriculum frameworks include program standards that are both academically integrated and responsive to business and industry.
title: Information Technology

description: Manitoba Specific Learning Outcomes for Chemistry for Grade 11 provides the basis for learning, teaching, and assessing chemistry in Manitoba.
title: Manitoba Specific Learning Outcomes for Chemistry (Grade 11)

description: Manitoba General Learning Outcomes and Skills for Chemistry for Grade 11 provides the basis for learning,teaching, and assessing chemistry in Manitoba.
title: Manitoba General Learning Outcomes and Skills for Chemistry (Grade 11)

description: Manitoba Science for Grade 10 prepares all students to continue their study of science in high school. All students benefit from a general understanding of science for their personal lives and future plans, regardless of their career and/or post-secondary educational choices.
title: Manitoba Science (Grade 10)

description: Manitoba Science for Grade 9 prepares all students to continue their study of science in high school. All students benefit from a general understanding of science for their personal lives and future plans, regardless of their career and/or post-secondary educational choices.
title: Manitoba Science (Grade 9)

description: Manitoba Psychology for Grade 12 exposes students to the major topics found in the field of psychology. It also emphasizes the issues that are of particular direct interest and relevance to students completing high school. Students explore the scientific methods upon which psychology is based. They can then apply what they learned to their daily lives.
title: Manitoba Psychology (Grade 12)

description: In Manitoba, Industrial Arts programming represents a wide variety of learning opportunities that focus on fundamental personal and production skill development. The Manitoba Power Mechanics Technology for Grade 9 provides students with the knowledge and skills to pursue careers in power mechanics technology.
title: Manitoba Power Mechanics Technology (Grade 9)

description: Manitoba Drafting Outcomes for Grade 10 is intended for students wishing to further their knowledge and skills in drafting.
title: Manitoba Drafting Outcomes (Grade 10)

description: Manitoba Electricity and Electronics Outcomes for Grade 10 prepares students for a career as industrial electricians, power electricians, or construction electricians.
title: Manitoba Electricity and Electronics Outcomes (Grade 10)

description: Manitoba Electricity and Electronics Outcomes for Grade 9 prepares students for a career as industrial electricians, power electricians, or construction electricians.
title: Manitoba Electricity and Electronics Outcomes (Grade 9)

description: Manitoba Drafting Outcomes for Grade 9 is an exploration of safety, employability skills, career development, sustainability, and new and emerging technologies in drafting.
title: Manitoba Drafting Outcomes (Grade 9)

description: Manitoba Indigenous Studies for Grade 12 focuses on strengthening students' knowledge and understanding of Indigenous histories, cultures, perspectives, and contributions.
title: Manitoba Indigenous Studies (Grade 12)

description: The purpose of Manitoba Spanish for Grade 9 helps students to develop a basic foundation in Spanish. Students will learn to speak, understand, read, and write simple Spanish, as well as introduce them to the history, geography, and diversity of Hispanic culture.
title: Manitoba Spanish (Grade 9)

description: Standards for Technical and Engineering Literacy provides an updated vision of what students should know and be able to do in order to be technologically and engineering literate. The document does not define a singular curriculum model nor does it claim to serve as STEM standards. It describes what the content and practices of technology and engineering education should be in Grades Pre-K-12.
jurisdiction: International Technology and Engineering Educators Association
title: Standards for Technical and Engineering Literacy

description: The Science Georgia Standards of Excellence are designed to provide foundational knowledge and skills for all students to develop proficiency in science. The standards are a required minimum set of expectations that show proficiency in science. However, instruction can extend beyond these minimum expectations to meet student needs.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Zoology

description: The Science Georgia Standards of Excellence are designed to provide foundational knowledge and skills for all students to develop proficiency in science. They are hands-on, student-centered, and inquiry-based approaches that should be the emphasis of instruction. The standards are a required minimum set of expectations that show proficiency in science. However, instruction can extend beyond these minimum expectations to meet student needs.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Oceanography

description: The Science Georgia Standards of Excellence drive instruction. Hands-on, student-centered, and inquiry-based approaches should be the emphasis of instruction. The standards are a required minimum set of expectations that show proficiency in science. However, instruction can extend beyond these minimum expectations to meet student needs.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Microbiology

description: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Meteorology drive instruction. Hands-on, student-centered, and inquiry-based approaches should be the emphasis of instruction. The standards are a required minimum set of expectations that show proficiency in meteorology. However, instruction can extend beyond these minimum expectations to meet student needs.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Meteorology

description: The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Human Anatomy & Physiology curriculum is extensively performance and laboratory based. It integrates the study of the structures and functions of the human body, however rather than focusing on distinct anatomical and physiological systems (respiratory, nervous, etc.) instruction should focus on the essential requirements for life.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Human Anatomy & Physiology

description: The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Geology is designed to lead the student toward a successful understanding of introductory geologic science. The goal of this course is to provide students with a basic understanding of geology, geologic processes, and how geology impacts our society.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Geology

description: The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Forensic Science are designed to build upon science concepts from previous courses and apply science to the investigation of crime scenes. Students will learn the scientific protocols for analyzing a crime scene, chemical and physical separation methods to isolate and identify materials, how to analyze biological evidence, and the criminal use of tools, including impressions from firearms, tool marks, arson, and explosive evidence.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Forensic Science

description: The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Epidemiology are designed to extend student investigations that begin in biology. This curriculum is performance-based. It integrates scientific investigations using real world situations to find patterns and determine causation of pathological conditions. Instruction should focus on the design, implementation, and evaluation of studies to increase students' media literacy and their understanding of public health.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Epidemiology

description: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Entomology are designed to continue student investigations that began in grades K-8 and high school biology. To achieve the goal of entomological literacy these standards provide students with basic understanding of insect biology as it relates to agriculture, animal and human health, ecosystem functioning and monitoring, and insect products. Students will investigate these entomological concepts through laboratory and field experience using the processes of inquiry.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Entomology

description: The Science Georgia Standards of Excellence are designed to provide foundational knowledge and skills for all students to develop proficiency in science. The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Ecology is lab and field based. Students will study the distribution and abundance of life and interactions between and among organisms and their environment, including the impact of human activities on the natural world.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Ecology

description: The standards presented in this document are created to guide the teacher through a course in botany that allows the student to feel confident at an introductory level for this field. These standards are meant to motivate students toward a genuine interest in botany and its related fields with possible job interests for the future. The skills a student masters through this coursework should help to prepare them for a related occupation, demonstrate proficiency in a college course of the same nature, and enrich their skill level for any additional science courses.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Botany

description: The Science Georgia Standards of Excellence are designed to provide foundational knowledge and skills for all students to develop proficiency in science. The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Astronomy course will provide the student with an introduction to the concepts of modern astronomy, the origin and history of the Universe, and the formation of the Earth and the solar system. Students will compare the Earth's properties with those of the other planets and explore how the heavens have influenced human thought and action.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Astronomy

description: The Wyoming Science Extended Content and Performance Standards are distinct from prior science standards in that they integrate three dimensions of learning within each standard and have intentional connections across standards, grade bands, and subjects.
title: Wyoming Science Extended Content and Performance Standards

description: These science standards are rich in both content and practice, and arranged in a coherent manner across disciplines and grades to provide all students an internationally benchmarked science education.
title: Maine's Learning Standards for Science (NGSS)

description: The Utah Science with SEEd Standards (Grades 9-12) were written with students in mind, including developmentally appropriate progressions that foster learning that is simultaneously age-appropriate and enduring. The aim was to address what an educated citizenry should know and understand to embrace the value of scientific thinking and make informed decisions. The SEEd standards are founded on what science is, how science is learned, and the multiple dimensions of scientific work.
title: Utah Science with SEEd Standards (Grades 9-12)

description: The Utah Science with SEEd Standards (Grades 3-5) were written with students in mind, including developmentally appropriate progressions that foster learning that is simultaneously age-appropriate and enduring. The aim was to address what an educated citizenry should know and understand to embrace the value of scientific thinking and make informed decisions. The SEEd standards are founded on what science is, how science is learned, and the multiple dimensions of scientific work.
title: Utah Science with SEEd Standards (Grades 3-5)

description: The Utah K-2 Science with SEEd Standards address what an educated citizenry should know and understand to embrace the value of scientific thinking and make informed decisions. The SEEd standards are founded on what science is, how science is learned, and the multiple dimensions of scientific work.
title: Utah Science with SEEd Standards (Grades K-2)

description: The North Dakota Science Content Standards give our educators, school administrators, and parents the information they need about what our students should know, and be able to do, during each step of their education journey, from kindergarten through high school. By using our new, challenging science standards to measure student achievement, we can monitor growth, address deficiencies, and ensure comparability of educational opportunity statewide.
title: North Dakota Science Content Standards

description: Manitoba German for Grade 9 introduces students to the German language and culture.
title: Manitoba German (Grade 9)

description: Manitoba German for Grade 10 is intended for students who have already completed Grade 9 German and have a basic understanding of the language. Students will enhance their ability to speak, read, and write in German, and expand their understanding of the language by developing new vocabulary and a more in-depth understanding of the structure of the language.
title: Manitoba German (Grade 10)

description: Manitoba German for Grade 11 provides teachers with student learning outcomes that can be used to develop curricula and implement German language of study courses.
title: Manitoba German (Grade 11)

description: Manitoba German for Grade 12 provides teachers with student learning outcomes that can be used to develop curricula and implement German language of study courses.
title: Manitoba German (Grade 12)

description: Manitoba Family Studies for Grade 12 provides students with the knowledge and skills required to strengthen individuals and families, as well as the knowledge, skills, and attitudes required to make informed choices with respect to caring for themselves and others within the context of a global community.
title: Manitoba Family Studies (Grade 12)

description: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Exploration for Grade 9 aims to help students acquire and apply knowledge and skills to make appropriate decisions for life, work, and the essential post-secondary education/training that is required in today's economy.
title: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Exploration (Grade 9)

description: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Planning for Grade 10 aims to help students acquire and apply knowledge and skills to make appropriate decisions for life, work, and the essential post-secondary education/training that is required in today's economy.
title: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Planning (Grade 10)

description: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Building for Grade 11 aims to help students acquire and apply knowledge and skills to make appropriate decisions for life, work, and the essential post-secondary education/training that is required in today's economy.
title: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Building (Grade 11)

description: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Transitioning for Grade 12 aims to help students acquire and apply knowledge and skills to make appropriate decisions for life, work, and the essential post-secondary education/training that is required in today's economy.
title: Manitoba Career Development: Life/Work Transitioning (Grade 12)

description: Manitoba Personal Finance for Grade 10 is intended to provide financial skills and knowledge and to help students feel more confident when it comes to managing personal finances.
title: Manitoba Personal Finance (Grade 10)

description: Manitoba Accounting Essentials for Grade 11 provides an introduction to the world of accounting. Students interested in a career in accounting, or students who may one day own their own business, are encouraged to take Accounting Essentials as the skills learned will transfer easily to most business careers.
title: Manitoba Accounting Essentials (Grade 11)

description: In Manitoba Accounting Systems for Grade 12, students learn how to process business transactions that deal with merchandise inventory in order to understand the unique relationship between sales and cost of goods sold.
title: Manitoba Accounting Systems (Grade 12)

description: Careers standards for middle school students.
title: CRE Careers Content Statements

description: Mathematics is the language that defines the blueprint of the universe. Mathematics is woven into all parts of our lives and is more than a list of skills to be mastered. The essence of mathematics is the ability to employ critical thinking and reasoning to solve problems. To be successful in mathematics, one must see mathematics as sensible, useful, and worthwhile. The 2018 Wyoming Mathematics Content and Performance Standards address two kinds of knowledge: mathematical content and mathematical practice.
title: Wyoming Mathematics Content and Performance Standards

description: The benchmarks for Florida's B.E.S.T. Standards English Language Arts are mastery goals that students are expected to attain by the end of the year. To build mastery, students will continue to review and apply earlier grade-level benchmarks and expectations. If skills are not mastered, students will be given instruction and practice opportunities to address skill gaps from previous grades.
title: Florida's B.E.S.T. Standards English Language Arts

description: The South Carolina Social Studies College- and Career-Ready Standards provide the basis for the development of local social studies curricula and statewide assessment. The standards describe for each grade and high school core area the specific areas of student learning that are considered the most important for proficiency in social studies at the particular level.
title: South Carolina Social Studies College- and Career-Ready Standards

description: Business standards for grades 9-12.
title: CTE Business Content Statements

description: The Alabama Course of Study: English Language Arts presents a sound framework designed to prepare students for the English Language Arts demands in both college studies and careers. Within this document is a set of challenging content standards for students at each grade level.
title: Alabama Course of Study: English Language Arts

description: The Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Dance develop cognitive functioning and increase student academic achievement, higher-order thinking, communication, and collaboration skills, making the study of dance applicable to college readiness, career opportunities, workplace environments, social skills, and everyday life. Students develop aesthetic and cultural awareness through exploration, leading to creative expression.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Dance

description: The Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Theatre increase student academic achievement, higher-order thinking, communication, and collaboration skills, making the study of theatre arts applicable to college readiness, career opportunities, workplace environments, social skills, and everyday life. Students develop aesthetic and cultural awareness through exploration, leading to creative expression.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Theatre

description: The Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Music engage and motivate all students through active learning, critical thinking, and innovative problem solving. The study of music develops cognitive functioning and increase student academic achievement, higher-order thinking, communication, and collaboration skills, making music applicable to college readiness, career opportunities, workplace environments, social skills, and everyday life. Students develop aesthetic and cultural awareness through exploration, leading to creative expression.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Music

description: The Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Art develop cognitive functioning and increase student academic achievement, higher-order thinking, communication, and collaboration skills, making visual art applicable to college readiness, career opportunities, workplace environments, social skills, and everyday life. Students develop aesthetic and cultural awareness through exploration, leading to creative expression. Creativity, encouraged through the study of visual art, is essential to nurture and develop the whole child.
title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Art

description: The Maryland Dance Education Framework aims to promote meaningful engagement in dance education for all Maryland students.
title: Maryland Dance Education Framework

description: The Maryland Theatre Education Framework aims to promote meaningful engagement in theatre education for all Maryland students.
title: Maryland Theatre Education Framework

description: The Maryland Visual Arts Education Framework aims to promote meaningful engagement in visual art education for all Maryland students.

description: The Maryland Music Education Framework aims to promote meaningful engagement in music education for all Maryland students.

description: The Maryland Media Arts Education Framework aims to promote meaningful engagement in media arts education for all Maryland students.
title: Maryland Media Arts Education Framework

description: The Maryland Technology Education Standards establish expectations of what technologically literate students should know and be able to do upon graduation from high school. This document is not a curriculum. Local school system leaders can develop or adopt curriculum that will provide the opportunity for students to demonstrate mastery of standards.
title: Maryland Technology Education Standards

description: The Maryland Comprehensive Health Education Framework are standards that focus on students' development of protective life skills that promote health and well-being. By participating in a variety of learning experiences, students are able to develop adaptive and positive behaviors that will equip them to meet the demands and challenges of everyday life.
title: Maryland Comprehensive Health Education Framework

description: The Maryland K-12 Physical Education Framework helps to develop physically literate individuals who have the knowledge, skills and confidence to enjoy a lifetime of healthful physical activity.
title: Maryland K-12 Physical Education Framework

description: The Maryland American Government Framework provides students with the opportunity to learn the Constitutional framework and democratic process that structure the State and national political system. The standards also establishe a knowledge base which supports the development of skills needed for citizens in a participatory democracy.
title: Maryland American Government Framework

description: Modern World History focuses on developing students' understanding of world history from approximately 1300 to the present. Students will explore how humans have thought, behaved and interacted across the ages in order to develop an understanding of global patterns of change and continuity.
title: Maryland Modern World History Framework

description: These Standards define what students should understand and be able to do in their study of mathematics. Asking a student to understand something means asking a teacher to assess whether the student has understood it. But what does mathematical understanding look like? One hallmark of mathematical understanding is the ability to justify, in a way appropriate to the student's mathematical maturity, why a particular mathematical statement is true or where a mathematical rule comes from. There is a world of difference between a student who can summon a mnemonic device to expand a product such as (a + b)(x + y) and a student who can explain where the mnemonic comes from. The student who can explain the rule understands the mathematics, and may have a better chance to succeed at a less familiar task such as expanding (a + b + c)(x + y). Mathematical understanding and procedural skill are equally important, and both are assessable using mathematical tasks of sufficient richness.
title: Common Core State Standards for Mathematics

description: Eighth grade United States History focuses on developing students' understanding of American History from Colonization until the dawn of the 20th Century. Students will analyze the processes and mechanisms that increased the body politic and the impact of different cultures on the development of an American identity. By considering events from multiple perspectives students will understand that women, African Americans, Native Americans and other minorities possess historical agency. Awareness of these processes assist student comprehension of the complicated nature of the American story.
title: Maryland Middle School United States History Framework

description: The study of Language Arts teaches students how to effectively communicate and to use related knowledge and contexts to synthesize information into meaningful messages. The 2010 Minnesota K-12 Academic Standards in English Language Arts use the Common Core State Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science and Technical Subjects as a base. Additional standards were added to address state statutory requirements and best practices. Appendices to the standards and guidelines for how to apply the standards for English Language Learners and students with disabilities are available on the Common Core website.
title: Minnesota Academic Standards in English Language Arts

description: The Business Management and Administration Career Cluster focuses on careers in planning, organizing, directing, and evaluating business functions essential to efficient and productive business operations.
title: Business Management and Administration

description: The Indiana Academic Standards for English Language Arts are the result of a process designed to identify, evaluate, synthesize, and create the highest quality, rigorous standards for Indiana students. The standards are designed to ensure that all Indiana students, upon graduation, are prepared for both college and career opportunities. In alignment with Indiana's Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) plan, the academic standards reflect the core belief that all students can achieve at a high level.
title: Indiana Academic Standards English Language Arts: Grade 1

description: The Utah Core State Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects are the culmination of an extended, broad-based effort to fulfill the charge issued by the states to create the next generation of K–12 standards in order to help ensure that all students are college and career ready in literacy no later than the end of high school.
title: Utah Core State Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

description: Florida's B.E.S.T. Standards for Mathematics reflect the concerns of parents, feedback from stakeholders and the practical experience of teachers. These new standards will lay the foundation for higher quality instructional materials, streamlined assessments, and ultimately high school graduates fully prepared for the responsibilities associated with American citizenship.
title: Florida's B.E.S.T. Standards Mathematics

description: These Standards define what K-12 students should understand and be able to do in their study of mathematics. The Standards set grade-specific standards but do not define the intervention methods or materials necessary to support students who are well below or well above grade-level expectations. However, the Standards do provide clear signposts along the way to the goal of post-secondary success for all students.
title: Kansas Mathematics Standards

description: High academic standards are an important first step in ensuring that all Alaska's students have the tools they need for success. These standards reflect the collaborative work of Alaskan educators and national experts from the nonprofit National Center for the Improvement of Educational Assessment. Further, they are informed by public comments. Alaskan teachers have played a key role in this effort, ensuring that the standards reflect the realities of the classroom. Since work began in spring 2010, the standards have undergone a thoughtful and rigorous drafting and refining process.
title: Alaska English/Language Arts Standards

description: Ontario Catholic elementary schools strive to support high-quality faith-based learning while giving every child the opportunity to learn in the way that is best suited to the child's individual strengths and needs, according to each child's God-given gifts. The Ontario Catholic School Kindergarten Program sets out principles, expectations for learning, and pedagogical approaches that are developmentally appropriate for four- and five-year-old children.
title: Ontario Catholic School Kindergarten Program

description: The English curriculum is based on the belief that language learning is critical to responsible and productive citizenship, and that all students can become successful language learners. The curriculum is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills that they need to achieve this goal. It aims to help students become successful language learners.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 11 and 12: English

description: The English curriculum is based on the belief that language learning is critical to responsible and productive citizenship, and that all students can become successful language learners. The curriculum is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills that they need to achieve this goal. It aims to help students become successful language learners.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 9 and 10: English

description: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 1–8: Language, 2006 identifies the expectations for each grade and describes the knowledge and skills that students are expected to acquire, demonstrate, and apply in their class work and investigations, on tests, and in various other activities on which their achievement is assessed and evaluated.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 1-8: Language

description: The senior mathematics courses build on the Grade 9 and 10 program, relying on the same fundamental principles on which that program was based. Both are founded on the premise that students learn mathematics most effectively when they build a thorough understanding of mathematical concepts and procedures. Such understanding is achieved when mathematical concepts and procedures are introduced through an investigative approach and connected to students' prior knowledge in meaningful ways. This curriculum is designed to help students prepare for university, college, or the workplace by building a solid conceptual foundation in mathematics that will enable them to apply their knowledge and skills in a variety of ways and further their learning successfully.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 11 and 12: Mathematics

description: The Grade 9 and 10 mathematics program builds on the elementary program, relying on the same fundamental principles on which that program was based. Both are founded on the premise that students learn mathematics most effectively when they have a thorough understanding of mathematical concepts and procedures, and when they build that understanding through an investigative approach, as reflected in the inquiry model of learning. This curriculum is designed to help students build a solid conceptual foundation in mathematics that will enable them to apply their knowledge and skills and further their learning successfully.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 9 and 10: Mathematics

description: This course enables students to deepen their understanding of how the Church engages contemporary culture with faith and reason, in pursuit of love, justice, and the common good. Students will have opportunity to learn how living the Baptismal vocation to a virtuous life, filled with the joy of the Gospel and nurtured by the sacraments, can transform them and society from within, allowing God to reign in human hearts. Students will also refine research and inquiry skills.
title: Grade 12 University/College: Church and Culture (HRE 4M)

description: This course enables students to develop an understanding of the theoretical, social, and historical underpinnings of various equity and social justice issues and to analyse strategies for bringing about positive social change. Students will learn about historical and contemporary equity and social justice issues in Canada and globally. They will explore power relations and the impact of a variety of factors on equity and social justice.
title: Grade 12 University/College Preparation: Equity and Social Justice (HSE 4M)

description: This course has the aim of assisting students in understanding themselves as moral persons living the way of Christ through an examination of the revelation of sacred Scripture, and the experience and teaching of the Catholic Church. It engages students in critical reflection on significant contemporary moral and ethical issues in light of Scripture, Church teaching, and their own experiences (i.e., Theological Reflection). Social and ecological justice issues are explored along with a study of topics that focus on Christian mercy and forgiveness.
title: Grade 12 OPEN: Church and Culture

description: This course engages students in the examination of world religions, particularly Judaism, Christianity, Islam and the First Nations, Métis and Inuit Spiritualities and a locally appropriate religious tradition. This is a survey course that will help students understand the basic similarities and differences between the religious traditions so they can interact with others with acceptance and familiarity. We live in a multi-faith global community. With the knowledge of this course, students ought to be able to understand more clearly the world's religious affairs.
title: Grade 11 University/College: Faith and Culture - World Religions (HRE 3M)

description: This course engages students in the examination of world religions, particularly Judaism, Christianity and Islam, First Nations, Metis and Inuit Spiritualties, and locally appropriate religious traditions (s), if suitable. This is a survey course that will help students understand the basic similarities and differences between the religious traditions so they can interact with others with acceptance and familiarity. Ontario is a multi-faith global community. Students will deepen their understanding of the various faith traditions in their local community and around the world.
title: Grade 11 OPEN: Faith and Culture - World Religions (HRE 30)

description: Grade 10 Civics: Stewards of the Gift explores Ontario Catholics' long struggle for recognition of their constitutional rights to operate and control their own schools. The intent of this course is to use the story of the challenges faced by the Ontario Catholic community to secure minority religious rights through the democratic process where it is the civic responsibility of all informed citizens to advocate for their rights.
title: Grade 10 Civics: Stewards of the Gift

description: Grade 10 OPEN: Christ and Culture (HRE 20) both invites and challenges the adolescent to personalize the Gospel values and social justice principles that guide Catholics in understanding their role in shaping culture as disciples of Jesus. Students will explore such foundational topics as: what it means to be human, created in God's image, what is culture, Christ and culture, living together in solidarity, social justice, prayer and sacrament, friendship and intimacy. Connections between the living Church and contemporary culture are explored in terms of what it means to be a responsible Christian adolescent in a secularized, pluralistic world.
title: Grade 10 OPEN: Christ and Culture (HRE 20)

description: Discipleship and Culture (Grade 9 OPEN: HRE-10) engages students in the examination of the Christian narrative as revealed in Sacred Scripture. Students explore discipleship as encountered in the Sacred Tradition of the Church (Sacraments, Liturgical Year and Church Teaching and Law), as part of their ongoing personal growth and faith understanding. Students explore Catholic rituals, teaching, practice, morals and values, and virtues to facilitate a healthy and covenantal relationship with self, God and with others.
title: Grade 9 OPEN: Discipleship and Culture (HRE 10)

description: ACM - Animal Care and Management Training Package
jurisdiction: Australian Government Department of Education and Training
title: ACM - Animal Care and Management Training Package

description: All students receive social studies instruction from Kindergarten through grade 12. Today's challenges are complex, have global implications, and are connected to people, places, and events of the past. The study of social studies focuses on deep understanding of concepts that enable students to think critically and systematically about local, regional, national, and global issues. Authentic learning experiences that enable students to apply content knowledge, develop social studies skills, and collaborate with students from around the world prepare New Jersey students for college, careers, and civic life.
title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards – Social Studies

description: The Kansas Standards for History, Government, and Social Studies prepare students to be informed, thoughtful, engaged citizens as they enrich their communities, state, nation, world, and themselves.
title: Kansas History, Government, and Social Studies Standards

description: The Nebraska Social Studies Standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should learn, but they do not prescribe particular curriculum, lessons, teaching techniques, or activities. These standards create a framework for teaching and learning, and they articulate a trajectory for knowledge acquisition across all grade levels. This ensures that student learning builds on prior knowledge and becomes more in-depth over time. Standards describe what students are expected to know and be able to do, while the local curriculum and instructional materials are used to help students master the standards. Decisions about curriculum and instructional materials are made locally by individual school districts and classroom teachers. The Nebraska Department of Education does not mandate the curriculum or instructional materials used within a local school.
title: Nebraska Social Studies Standards

description: Oceti Sakowin (historically, known to some as the Sioux Nation) is a Native confederacy speaking three different dialects: the Lakota, Dakota and Nakota. The Oceti Sakowin has a complex history that is not known by many today, yet has a distinct and unique interrelationship with the environment and culture that is essential to South Dakota.
title: South Dakota Oceti Sakowin Essential Understandings & Standards

description: The 2018 MS CCRS for the Social Studies reflect national expectations while focusing on post-secondary success, but they are unique to Mississippi in addressing the needs of our students and teachers. They are designed to provide districts and K-12 social studies teachers with a basis for curriculum development. In order to prepare students for careers and college, it outlines what knowledge students should obtain, and the types of skills students must master upon successful completion of each grade level
title: Mississippi College- and Career-Ready Standards for the Social Studies

description: The North Dakota Social Studies Content Standards provide our educators, school administrators, and parents concise statements of what our students should know and be able to do during each step of their education journey, from kindergarten through high school.
title: North Dakota Social Studies Content Standards

description: The Washington State K-12 Learning Standards for Social Studies provide a grade-by-grade sequence of concepts, regional areas, and chronological periods. Local school districts are not required to follow this exact sequence, however, districts are encouraged to consider the mobility of their students and the advantages of following the recommended sequence to ensure that students have equitable access to all of the skills that build a strong social studies background regardless of where they reside in the state. The goal of the Learning Standards is to help teachers and local districts design the scope and sequence of their social studies programs, and to develop lessons and instruction that ensure all students have an opportunity to master the skills and standards the Learning Standards describe.
title: Washington State K-12 Learning Standards for Social Studies

description: The Oklahoma Academic Standards for Science specify what students should know and be able to do as learners of science at the end of each grade level or science course. The order of the standards at any grade level is not meant to imply a sequence of topics and should be considered flexible for the organization of any course. The Oklahoma Academic Standards describe the specific areas of student learning that are considered the most important for proficiency in the discipline at a particular level and provide a basis for the development of local curricula and statewide assessments.
title: Oklahoma Academic Standards for Science

description: The New Jersey Student Learning Standards for Science (NJSLS-S) describe the expectations for what students should know and be able to do as well as promote three-dimensional science instruction across the three science domains (i.e., physical sciences, life science, earth and space sciences). From the earliest grades, the expectation is that students will engage in learning experiences that enable them to investigate phenomena, design solutions to problems, make sense of evidence to construct arguments, and critique and discuss those arguments.
title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards - Science

description: The 2020 Alabama Course of Study: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) was developed by educators and business and community leaders to provide a foundation for building quality STEM programs across the state. Implementing the content of this document through appropriate instruction will promote students' exploration and engagement in STEM content and enhance preparation for STEM career fields.
title: Alabama Course of Study: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM)

description: The STEM Standards of Practice Framework for grades K-5 is a foundational course experience providing students the opportunity to deepen their understanding of the content connections that exist between science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM).
title: Tennessee STEM Standards of Practice Framework (K-5)

description: To address the critical issues of U.S. competitiveness and to better prepare the workforce, the K-12 Science Standards for Alaska proposes a new approach to K-12 science education that will capture students' interest and provide them with the necessary foundational knowledge in the field. Science, engineering, and technology permeate nearly every facet of modern life and hold the key to solving many of humanity's most pressing current and future challenges.
title: K-12 Science Standards for Alaska

description: The Georgia Standards of Excellence: Journalism helps prepare students for professional careers in newspapers, magazines, television, radio, news agencies, publishing, and public information services. In today's market, the ability to communicate not only involves speaking, writing and reading but requires that journalists understand and utilize the multi-media technology required to distribute stories across digital delivery platforms.
title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Journalism

description: A strong mathematics education depends upon a clear understanding of its interrelated concepts, skills and practices to ensure students are on the pathway to success in their academic careers. The knowledge and skills students need to be prepared for mathematics in college, career, and life are woven throughout the Maine Learning Results: Mathematics performance expectations.
title: Maine Learning Results: Mathematics

description: International Baccalaureate Language & Literature is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of literature and English language in schools. Students are introduced to the critical study and interpretation of written and spoken texts from a wide range of literary forms and non literary text-types. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Language & Literature

description: International Baccalaureate Science is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of chemistry, biology, physics, and sport science in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Science

description: The International Baccalaureate Further Mathematics HL Guide is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of advanced math in schools. These courses are designed for different types of students: those who wish to study mathematics in depth, either as a subject in its own right or to pursue their interests in areas related to mathematics; those who wish to gain a degree of understanding and competence to understand better their approach to other subjects; and those who may not as yet be aware how mathematics may be relevant to their studies and in their daily lives.
title: International Baccalaureate Further Mathematics HL Guide

description: International Baccalaureate Math Analysis, Approaches, Applications & Interpretations is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of mathematical analysis in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Math Analysis, Approaches, Applications & Interpretations

description: International Baccalaureate Classical Languages is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of Latin and Classical Greek in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Classical Languages

description: International Baccalaureate Language AB Initio & Language B is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of international languages in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Language AB Initio & Language B

description: International Baccalaureate Individuals & Societies is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of history, economics, geography, and environmental systems and society in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Individuals & Societies

description: The International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme Core is comprised of three elements (Theory of Knowledge, Creativity, Activity and Service, and the extended essay) as a way to educate the whole person. Strongly committed to the principle of developing the whole person, the IB believes that this is best achieved by identifying and developing these three elements, and how they relate to each other.
title: International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme Core

description: International Baccalaureate Visual Artsis intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of visual arts in schools. Consistent with the educational philosophy of the IB, the Diploma Programme visual arts course encourages students to challenge their own creative and cultural expectations and boundaries. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Visual Arts

description: Theatre is a dynamic, collaborative and live art form. It is a practical subject that encourages discovery through experimentation, the taking of risks and the presentation of ideas to others. International Baccalaureate Theatre is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of theatre in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Theatre

description: Music functions as a means of personal and communal identity and expression, and embodies the social and cultural values of individuals and communities. International Baccalaureate Music is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of music in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Music

description: The International Baccalaureate Film course aims to develop students as proficient interpreters and makers of film texts. IB Film is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of the subject in schools. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Film

description: International Baccalaureate Dance is intended to guide the planning, teaching and assessment of dance in schools. Consistent with the educational philosophy of the IB, the Diploma Programme dance curriculum aims for a holistic approach to dance, and embraces a variety of dance traditions and dance cultures. Subject teachers are the primary audience, although it is expected that teachers will use the guide to inform students and parents about the subject.
title: International Baccalaureate Dance

description: The Architecture & Construction career cluster contains detailed curriculum frameworks. With partners from education, business and industry, and trade associations, the curriculum frameworks include program standards that are both academically integrated and responsive to business and industry.
title: Architecture & Construction

description: The Automotive Service standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to pursue a career in the automotive service industry.
title: Automotive Service

description: The Automotive Systems standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to pursue a career in the automotive systems industry. Topics include transmissions, transaxles, drive train, suspension, brakes, and more.
title: Automotive Systems

description: The Video and Multimedia Journalism standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in filming, editing, designing, producing, and distributing news and other event footage.
title: Video and Multimedia Journalism

description: The Restaurant Operations standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in the restaurant and foodservice industries.
title: Restaurant Operations

description: The Residential Construction standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in the construction and maintenance of residential structures.
title: Residential Construction

description: The Pre-Nursing Standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career as a nursing assistant. Topics include patient care, use of assistive devices, employability skills, and more.
title: Pre-Nursing Standards

description: The Pre-Nursing Internship Standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a nursing assistant internship. Topics include patient care, use of assistive devices, employability skills, and more.
title: Pre-Nursing Internship Standards

description: The Outdoor Leadership standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in outdoor recreation activities. Topics include trip planning, safety, camping, hunting whitewater rafting, and more.
title: Outdoor Leadership

description: The Machinist Operations standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to operate a variety of machines and tools. Machines covered include bench grinders, bandsaws, lathes, and more.
title: Machinist Operations

description: The Machine Tool Standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in Machine Manufacturing. Topics include the operation of various types of tools such as lathes, saws, drills, grinders and milling machines, as well as developing a career plan and creating a portfolio.
title: Machine Tool Standards

description: The Law Enforcement & Police Patrol standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in law enforcement. Topics include traffic, criminal, liquor, juvenile, and other laws, as well as basic procedures and ethics.
title: Law Enforcement & Police Patrol

description: The IT Support Specialist standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in providing support for information technologies in a variety of settings.
title: IT Support Specialist

description: The Forestry & Wildlife Management standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in National Parks, recreation areas, fish and game locations, etc.. Topics include surveying and cartography, wildlife, fish, endangered species, forests, and more.
title: Forestry & Wildlife Management

description: The Food Preparation standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career in food service. Topics include food service safety and sanitation, preparing entrees, sauces, desserts, and more.
title: Food Preparation

description: The Firefighting standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career as a firefighter. Topics include workforce safety, equipment, building construction, and more.
title: Firefighting

description: The Finish Carpentry standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career as finish carpenter. Topics include woodworking fundamentals, different types of tools, fasteners, and adhesives, different types of construction methods, and more.
title: Finish Carpentry

description: The EMT Basic standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain in order to pursue a career as an emergency medical technician. Topics include workforce safety, medical, legal, and ethical issues, patient assessment, pharmacology, medical shock, respiratory emergencies, and more.
title: EMT Basic Standards

description: The Electrical II standards build on the Electrical I course content, and describe the knowledge and skills that students should to pursue a career as an electrician. Topic include electrical theory and national codes, residential and commercial wiring, safety, and more.
title: Electrical II

description: The Electrical 1 standards describe the introductory knowledge and skills that students should obtain to pursue a career as an electrician.
title: Electrical 1

description: The Early Childhood standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to prepare for a career in early childhood education.
title: Early Childhood

description: The CTE Academy standards describe the introductory knowledge and skills that students will obtain to learn about various fields, such as automotive services and repair, construction industries, culinary arts, and more.
title: CTE Academy

description: The Crime Investigation & Criminology standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to carefully and efficiently process and investigate crime scenes, child and domestic abuse cases, terrorist activities, and more.
title: Crime Investigation & Criminology

description: The Child Care standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to help promote and foster the healthy development of children and their learning.
title: Child Care

description: The Broadcasting & Multimedia Production standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to understand and participate in media project management, camera operation and audio production, video editing and design, and much more.
title: Broadcasting & Multimedia Production

description: The Apple Technology & App Development standards describe the knowledge and skills that students should obtain to troubleshoot, service, repair, and provide customer support for Apple products and technologies such as iPhones and Macintosh systems. Topics such as network infrastructure, security, operations, and troubleshooting are also covered.
title: Apple Technology & App Development

description: South Dakota State Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects K-12 were developed to ensure that all students are college, career and life ready in literacy by high school graduation. The standards are tailored specifically to meet the needs of students in South Dakota, ensuring a readiness for the workforce, military service, university or technical school coursework. The standards met the following qualifications (1) research and evidence based, (2) aligned with college and work expectations, (3) rigorous, and (4) benchmarked in their design and content.
title: South Dakota State Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

description: Ce document remplace le Programme d'apprentissage à temps plein de la maternelle et du jardin d'enfants, version provisoire, 2010-2011. description: Literacy includes reading, writing, and the creative and analytical acts involved in producing and comprehending texts. Reading and writing are important to ensure success in school, on the job, and in society. Today's expectations, however, encompass more than the ability to read, write, speak, and listen. The AERO K-8 English Language Arts Curriculum Framework expectations include use of oral and written language to make sense of the world and to communicate, problem solve, and participate in decision-making.
title: AERO K-8 English Language Arts Curriculum Framework

description: Students in Louisiana are ready for college or a career if they are able to meet college and workplace expectations without needing remediation in mathematics skills and concepts. description: Life and Career Ready standards in Maine include an emphasis on multiple pathways toward meaningful careers and focus on life skills and experiences that will allow students to pivot as economic needs change and personal interests evolve. title: Maine Learning Results: Life and Career Ready Standards

description: Without knowledge of the geography and economics of earlier times, history offers only lists of people, events, and dates. Without knowledge of history, the institutions of American government and the dynamics of today's global economy are difficult to understand. Although social studies curricula vary in their breadth and depth, the Maine Learning Results for Social Studies reflect a focus on government, history, geography, personal finance and economics as the pillars of the content, with other disciplines within the social sciences deemed important, but not essential.
title: Maine Learning Results for Social Studies

description: Le curriculum de l'Ontario de la 1re à la 8e année – Mathématiques, 2020 est axé sur les concepts et les habiletés mathématiques fondamentaux ainsi que sur les liens entre les concepts, entre les mathématiques et d'autres matières, et entre les mathématiques et la vie quotidienne. Il soutient également le nouvel apprentissage au sujet de la modélisation mathématique, du codage et de la littératie financière, et intègre l'apprentissage des mathématiques aux autres disciplines STIM (sciences, technologie, ingénierie et mathématiques). Aussi, ce programme-cadre est conçu pour aider les élèves à s'engager dans leur apprentissage des mathématiques avec confiance, à acquérir une attitude positive envers les mathématiques, à gérer le stress et l'anxiété, à persévérer et à tirer des leçons de leurs erreurs, à travailler de concert avec les autres pour atteindre des objectifs communs, à valoriser l'approfondissement de la pensée et l'établissement de liens, et à devenir des apprenantes et apprenants des mathématiques compétents et confiants.
title: Le curriculum de l'Ontario de la 1re à la 8e année – Mathématiques, 2020

description: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 1–8: Mathematics, 2020 focuses on fundamental mathematics concepts and skills, as well as on making connections between related math concepts, between mathematics and other disciplines, and between mathematics and everyday life. It also supports new learning about mathematical modelling, coding, and financial literacy, and integrates mathematics learning with learning in other STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) subjects. As well, this curriculum is designed to help students build confidence in approaching mathematics and acquire a positive attitude towards mathematics, cope with stress and anxiety, persevere and learn from their mistakes, work collaboratively with others towards a shared goal, value deep thinking and making connections, and become capable and confident math learners.
title: The Ontario Curriculum, Grades 1–8: Mathematics, 2020

description: NC Math III progresses from the standards learned in Math I and Math II. In addition to these standards, Math III extends to include algebraic concepts such as: the complex number system, inverse functions, and trigonometric functions. Math III also includes the geometric concepts of angles and circles.
title: North Carolina Math III

description: The Missouri Learning Standards: Mathematics were developed by Missourians for Missouri classrooms. These standards define what students should understand and be able to do in their study of mathematics.

description: The Canadian Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) certification program provides the foundation on which to build a successful business career. The program is designed to meet the needs of public accounting, industry, and government by ensuring that all CPAs have a strong foundation of ethics, knowledge and skill to succeed and lead in any professional accounting role or position. By preparing aspiring professional accountants for positions of leadership, trust and authority, it will enable them to pursue opportunities that suit their areas of interest, whether that be as an auditor, chief financial officer, entrepreneur, or other positions where financial decision-making with integrity is essential.
title: CPA Competency Map

description: The British Columbia English Studies 12 course builds on and extends students' previous learning experiences in ELA and EFP 10 and 11 courses. It is designed for all students.
title: British Columbia English Studies 12

description: Le programme-cadre d'études des Premières Nations, des Métis et des Inuits vise à présenter aux élèves de l'Ontario la riche diversité des cultures, des traditions, des perspectives et des histoires des Premières Nations, des Métis et des Inuits, tout en soulignant l'importance capitale des connaissances et des formes du savoir autochtones dans un contexte contemporain mondial. Le présent document est destiné aux écoles de langue française.
title: Le curriculum de l'Ontario: Études des Premières Nations, des Métis et des Inuits

description: Le présent document Le curriculum de l'Ontario, de la 9e à la 12e année – Programme d'appui aux nouveaux arrivants, édition révisée, 2010 est destiné aux écoles de langue française. Le PANA maintient des attentes élevées et des contenus d'apprentissage rigoureux pour chaque année d'études et décrit les compétences à évaluer dans toutes les écoles de langue française de la province pour les élèves nouvellement arrivés. Destiné principalement au personnel enseignant, mais aussi aux élèves et à leurs parents1, ce programme-cadre a pour but de faciliter la planification de l'enseignement et de l'apprentissage de l'élève qui est nouvellement arrivé et d'assurer sa réussite à l'école de langue française.
title: Le curriculum de l'Ontario: Programme d'appui aux nouveaux arrivants (PANA 9-12 année)

title: Le curriculum de l'Ontario: Programme d'appui aux nouveaux arrivants (PANA 1-8 année)

Destiné principalement au personnel enseignant, mais aussi aux élèves et à leursparents1, ce programme-cadre a pour but de faciliter la planification de l'enseignementet de l'apprentissage de l'élève qui doit acquérir en français les compétences langagièresnécessaires pour assurer sa réussite à l'école de langue française.

description: Le présent document Le curriculum de l'Ontario, de la 1reà la 8eannée – Actualisation linguistique en français, édition révisée, 2010est destiné aux écoles de langue française. Le programme-cadre d'ALF maintient des attentes élevées et des contenus d'apprentissagerigoureux pour chaque année d'études et décrit les compétences à évaluer dans toutes les écoles de langue française de la province pour les élèves qui font l'apprentissage dufrançais.
